Twin Cities Hospital
About Us
HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital
We’re part of the largest network of doctors, nurses and care sites in the state. Our experienced care teams are focused on listening to you — caring for you like family. We work to understand your needs to provide a personalized care experience. From welcoming your newest family members to routine and specialty care needs throughout your life, you can count on us to show up for you when it matters.
View Our Specialties
Get directions
Call us
Classes and events
Newsroom
Contact us
Message from the CEO
First and foremost, please allow us to thank you for choosing HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital for your medical care.
You have given us the opportunity to honor your trust of providing for your health, and we will do our very best to send you home thinking, “Wow — that is an extraordinary hospital.” HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital and every living soul in it strive to be the best community hospital possible. Our staff of physicians are all top notch or they would not be here. Every employee, including ourselves, is committed to the single purpose of serving your healthcare needs at the highest level of excellence attainable. Together, the physicians and hospital employees are committed to you and your family.
We want you to be as comfortable as possible while you are staying with us. It is our goal to remove the fears and discomforts of being away from your home. Simple services such as dietary and housekeeping can make your time here less stressful. If we need to do anything to assist your particular needs in any area, please do not be shy — tell your nurse, or tell us. Listed below are a few key phone extensions that will be beneficial to have while you are staying with us.
Todd Jackson, FACHE, Chief Executive Officer
Sonna Harding, Chief Nursing Officer
Mark Day, Chief Financial Officer
HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital Statistics
45,081
Patients treated in 2020
330
Employees
87
Physicians
65
Licensed beds
Leadership
We are supported by a leadership team that is committed to bettering the lives of patients within the communities we serve. Our hospital leaders are experienced in many areas of healthcare and use their knowledge to improve the quality of care we provide.
View our leadership team
Awards and Recognitions
We strive to exceed our patients' needs. Our dedication to excellence in healthcare has led to us receiving awards and recognition from organizations such as Healthgrades and the American Heart Association.
View our awards and recognition
In the Community
To improve the health of the diverse communities we serve - and as part of HCA Healthcare, Florida's largest healthcare provider - we continue to take a leading role in fundamentally transforming how healthcare is provided. We also work in the partnership with other organizations to provide a wide range of community benefit programs and services.
View our 2019 Community Report
Business health
The best opportunity for businesses to start controlling the cost of healthcare is to help healthy employees stay healthy and to help others identify emerging and existing preventable health conditions.
Commit to Fit: Creating a culture of health
The best opportunity for businesses to start controlling the cost of healthcare is to help healthy employees stay healthy and to help others identify emerging and existing preventable health conditions. Through Commit to Fit, employers have access to low-cost screenings that identify the main drivers of healthcare costs: diabetes, cancer, cardiovascular disease and emotional health. The biometric screenings are just the first step in a process that leads to creating a culture of health and sustainable, healthy changes in the lives of employees and the companies they represent.
To learn more about our business health practices, visit our
business health page
.
Ethics and Compliance
For many years HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital has had an extensive ethics program which includes: defining standards of compliance and conduct; creating awareness of these standards among all our employees, volunteers, vendors and physicians; providing a means to report possible exceptions; monitoring and auditing performance of these standards; and establishing support for this entire effort. Our facility Ethics and Compliance Officer is responsible for this program.
A word from our Ethics & Compliance Officer
As I come to work each day, I spend a few quiet moments reflecting on what my day will bring. One thing that I know I can count on is that when I walk through the doors at HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital I will be surrounded by individuals that care deeply about doing the right thing. On a daily basis, our employees are committed to ensuring that whatever their job may be, it’s done to the best of their ability and with the utmost integrity, honesty and dignity.
A part of our Ethics and Compliance Program is a detailed Code of Conduct which all of our employees are educated on at the time of hire and annually thereafter. Our Code of Conduct is a vital part of our culture and the way we do business. At HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital we pride ourselves in knowing that our patients are receiving the best possible care in the best possible way.
We trust that you will be extremely satisfied with all of the care you receive and the conduct in which our employees conduct themselves, however if you or someone you know ever feels that there is an exception to this standard, I encourage you to contact me personally at
(850) 678-9509
.
Thank you for taking the time to visit our online home and we hope that the next time you are in need of medical services, you will allow our extraordinary staff to provide you with the extraordinary care you deserve!
Cyndi Ronca, SPHR, SHRM-SCP
Human Resources Director/Ethics and Compliance Officer

Twin Cities Hospital
Specialties
Orthopedic care
Orthopedists are doctors who take care of the entire musculoskeletal system. They diagnose and treat conditions such as sprains, strains, broken bones, arthritis and osteoporosis. Some of the treatments they offer include recommending lifestyle changes, applying casts and performing surgeries, such as ligament repairs or total joint replacements.
Find a Doctor
Get Directions
Call Consult-A-Nurse®: (844) 706-8773
Orthopedics in Niceville
From diagnosis to rehabilitation, we strive to provide comprehensive orthopedic care.
HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital offers comprehensive orthopedic services to patients in Niceville and Crestview. We understand spine and joint conditions can impact our patients' active lifestyles. Our orthopedic doctors are trained in advanced treatment options to resolve conditions and get our patients back on their feet.
Our orthopedic services
From preoperative education to postoperative rehabilitation, our orthopedic specialists provide patients with a complete continuum of orthopedic care.
Comprehensive orthopedic care
Our multidisciplinary team of orthopedic doctors, nurses, physical therapists and case managers work together to ensure high-quality patient care in the following services:
Spine care
Our spine specialists are experienced in treating a wide range of back and neck conditions. From chronic back pain to spinal disorders, like scoliosis, we provide full-service
spine care
to diagnose and treat our patients.
Joint replacement surgery
Joint Venture is our joint replacement program which includes surgery for total and partial hip and knee replacements, to remove damaged or diseased joints and replace them with artificial joints. Joint replacement surgery can reduce our patients' pain and help improve their functionality and mobility.
Anterior hip replacement
We are dedicated to providing advanced hip replacement surgery. We use the anterior approach for hip replacement, which can offer patients many benefits, including:
Improved quality of life
Increased leg strength
Reduced pain
Shorter recovery times
Preoperative joint replacement education
Through our orthopedic surgery Joint Venture program, we offer patients a preoperative educational class before their surgery led by a nurse certified in orthopedics. Our class allows patients to prepare for surgery and gain knowledge regarding the care they will receive during their hospital stay. We believe patients who are better informed and are active participants in their care can have better surgical outcomes.
Patients can expect the following from our joint replacement class:
An introduction to our orthopedic care team
An opportunity to ask any questions and ease anxieties related to the upcoming surgery
An overview of what to expect before, during and after surgery
A discharge planner teaches patients about home recovery, the types of special equipment needed and how to manage health conditions
A physical therapist teaches exercises that will be an integral part of their recovery process
Educational materials about their specific joint replacement procedure
After surgery is scheduled, individuals will be contacted by the Joint Venture program coordinator to schedule a preoperative educational class.
Orthopedic rehabilitation
Our
physical therapy
specialists are experienced with helping patients recover from orthopedic surgery.
If a patient requires more intensive rehabilitation, we offer the specialized rehabilitation services of our affiliated providers at the Rehabilitation Institute of Northwest Florida.  Our rehab experts provides individualized rehabilitation plans to help patients achieve their full potential through physical, occupational and recreational therapies.

Home
Classes and Events
Home
Classes and Events
Our hospital keeps patients and visitors informed and makes communication easy by providing contact information for each department through our phone directory.
To keep our patients and visitors informed, our hospital provides contact information through this online phone directory for each of our departments.

Twin Cities Hospital
Specialties
Emergency care
Emergency care is the treatment of unexpected, severe medical injuries or infections. It is typically delivered in an emergency room or an ambulance. Our emergency medicine physicians stabilize your condition as quickly as possible to prepare you for the next step of care or discharge.
Get Directions
Call Consult-A-Nurse®: (844) 706-8773
Emergency room in Niceville
Our ER specialists work together to provide expert emergency services to patients of all ages in one convenient location.
At HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital, our emergency room (ER) doctors offer 24/7 care to patients in Niceville and Crestview.  As a result of our commitment to delivering high-quality care, we received recognition from The Joint Commission as an Acute Stroke Ready Hospital. We are also recognized by Healthgrades for our dedication to patient safety.
Our emergency room features and services
Our ER team works around the clock to ensure you and your loved ones receive compassionate, comprehensive emergency care as quickly as possible.
Fast, collaborative emergency care
We designed our triage and treatment protocols to treat patients quickly while maintaining the highest levels of medical care. We communicate with our local emergency medical services teams directly to adequately prepare for our patients' arrivals. When patients reach our hospital, our board-certified physicians assess, diagnose and treat patients based on their individual needs.
Kid-friendly ER
We understand children have unique needs. We go the extra mile at our kid-friendly ER to ensure our youngest patients receive the bedside manner and care they deserved. Our board-certified emergency physicians, registered nurses and other qualified healthcare providers are specially trained to treat children and are available 24/7.
Advanced heart attack care
A heart attack occurs when blood is prevented from reaching the heart, usually due to a blood clot. If heart attack symptoms appear, it's important to seek immediate medical attention. Our ER offers 24/7 heart attack treatment and state-of-the-art
cardiac monitoring and testing
.
Expert stroke treatment
A stroke is a medical emergency where blood flow to the brain is either stopped or reduced, depriving brain tissue of oxygen. A stroke may cause a loss of brain function and affect movement and speech.
It's essential to act quickly when signs of stroke appear because fast treatment decreases the likelihood of stroke-related disability. As an Acute Stroke Ready Hospital, we are recognized for delivering high-quality stroke treatment when patients need it most.
Critical Care Unit
If a medical emergency requires critical care and an inpatient stay, we care for patients in our Critical Care Unit. Our team is made up of registered nurses who provide individualized care and medical management to patients 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
Our emergency room wait times
When it comes to emergency care, our goal is to continually work toward enhancing the care you receive, while reducing our wait times. This ensures you get the care you need, when you need it most.
Our wait times are updated every 30 minutes and are available on our website.
To find out the wait times of the HCA Florida emergency room nearest to you, check the top of our website or text "ER" to
32222
.
Note: Message and data rates may apply. Emergency room wait times are approximate and provided for informational purposes only.
When to go to the emergency room
Conditions that may require emergency care
We want you to feel secure about your choice for care, which is why we've created a list of symptoms that may indicate you need to visit the emergency room:
Back pain
, when it is unbearable or accompanied by fever, numbness, weakness, confusion, slurred speech, vision loss or loss of control over bladder or bowels
Broken bones
, when the pain is severe or there is a visible deformity
Chest pain
, when it is crushing or squeezing and accompanied by other
heart attack symptoms
, such as shortness of breath or nausea
Concussion
, when you have lost consciousness, even briefly, or experience amnesia, vomiting, slurred speech or a seizure
Flu
, when symptoms become severe, such as having trouble breathing, vomiting uncontrollably or becoming dehydrated
Side pain
, when it is severe and occurs in the lower right stomach, side or back or is accompanied by fever, nausea, diarrhea or blood in the urine
Stomach pain
, when accompanied by a hard or tender stomach, nausea, shortness of breath, fever or irregular heartbeat
Trouble breathing
, when breathing stops, is noisy or high-pitched and comes with pain in the chest or severe shortness of breath
If you are unsure if your symptoms require an emergency room visit, you can speak to a nurse 24/7 by calling our
Consult-A-Nurse line
.
What to expect at the emergency room
When you get to the emergency room, one of our triage nurses will assess your symptoms and vital signs. Next, a registration clerk will collect your insurance card (if available) and other information.
We medically screen, evaluate and stabilize all patients — whether or not they have insurance or are able to pay.
Anyone who has severe, life-threatening illnesses or injuries will be treated first. Everyone else will be treated in the order they arrive.
Before discharge, we encourage you to ask our emergency care teams any questions you have. It is also useful for you to keep all of your paperwork, discharge information and medicines or prescriptions together after you leave the emergency room.
What to bring to the emergency room
When coming to the emergency room, we recommend you bring:
A list of medicines you currently take
A list of known allergies
Copies of results from recent medical tests, if available
Personal care preferences and restrictions
A responsible adult or phone number for someone to contact

Twin Cities Hospital
About Us
HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital
We’re part of the largest network of doctors, nurses and care sites in the state. Our experienced care teams are focused on listening to you — caring for you like family. We work to understand your needs to provide a personalized care experience. From welcoming your newest family members to routine and specialty care needs throughout your life, you can count on us to show up for you when it matters.
View Our Specialties
Get directions
Call us
Classes and events
Newsroom
Contact us
Message from the CEO
First and foremost, please allow us to thank you for choosing HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital for your medical care.
You have given us the opportunity to honor your trust of providing for your health, and we will do our very best to send you home thinking, “Wow — that is an extraordinary hospital.” HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital and every living soul in it strive to be the best community hospital possible. Our staff of physicians are all top notch or they would not be here. Every employee, including ourselves, is committed to the single purpose of serving your healthcare needs at the highest level of excellence attainable. Together, the physicians and hospital employees are committed to you and your family.
We want you to be as comfortable as possible while you are staying with us. It is our goal to remove the fears and discomforts of being away from your home. Simple services such as dietary and housekeeping can make your time here less stressful. If we need to do anything to assist your particular needs in any area, please do not be shy — tell your nurse, or tell us. Listed below are a few key phone extensions that will be beneficial to have while you are staying with us.
Todd Jackson, FACHE, Chief Executive Officer
Sonna Harding, Chief Nursing Officer
Mark Day, Chief Financial Officer

Leadership
We are supported by a leadership team that is committed to bettering the lives of patients within the communities we serve. Our hospital leaders are experienced in many areas of healthcare and use their knowledge to improve the quality of care we provide.
View our leadership team
Awards and Recognitions
We strive to exceed our patients' needs. Our dedication to excellence in healthcare has led to us receiving awards and recognition from organizations such as Healthgrades and the American Heart Association.
View our awards and recognition
In the Community
To improve the health of the diverse communities we serve - and as part of HCA Healthcare, Florida's largest healthcare provider - we continue to take a leading role in fundamentally transforming how healthcare is provided. We also work in the partnership with other organizations to provide a wide range of community benefit programs and services.
View our 2019 Community Report
Business health
The best opportunity for businesses to start controlling the cost of healthcare is to help healthy employees stay healthy and to help others identify emerging and existing preventable health conditions.
Commit to Fit: Creating a culture of health
The best opportunity for businesses to start controlling the cost of healthcare is to help healthy employees stay healthy and to help others identify emerging and existing preventable health conditions. Through Commit to Fit, employers have access to low-cost screenings that identify the main drivers of healthcare costs: diabetes, cancer, cardiovascular disease and emotional health. The biometric screenings are just the first step in a process that leads to creating a culture of health and sustainable, healthy changes in the lives of employees and the companies they represent.
To learn more about our business health practices, visit our
business health page
.
Ethics and Compliance
For many years HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital has had an extensive ethics program which includes: defining standards of compliance and conduct; creating awareness of these standards among all our employees, volunteers, vendors and physicians; providing a means to report possible exceptions; monitoring and auditing performance of these standards; and establishing support for this entire effort. Our facility Ethics and Compliance Officer is responsible for this program.
A word from our Ethics & Compliance Officer
As I come to work each day, I spend a few quiet moments reflecting on what my day will bring. One thing that I know I can count on is that when I walk through the doors at HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital I will be surrounded by individuals that care deeply about doing the right thing. On a daily basis, our employees are committed to ensuring that whatever their job may be, it’s done to the best of their ability and with the utmost integrity, honesty and dignity.
A part of our Ethics and Compliance Program is a detailed Code of Conduct which all of our employees are educated on at the time of hire and annually thereafter. Our Code of Conduct is a vital part of our culture and the way we do business. At HCA Florida Twin Cities Hospital we pride ourselves in knowing that our patients are receiving the best possible care in the best possible way.
We trust that you will be extremely satisfied with all of the care you receive and the conduct in which our employees conduct themselves, however if you or someone you know ever feels that there is an exception to this standard, I encourage you to contact me personally at
(850) 678-9509
.
Thank you for taking the time to visit our online home and we hope that the next time you are in need of medical services, you will allow our extraordinary staff to provide you with the extraordinary care you deserve!
Cyndi Ronca, SPHR, SHRM-SCP
Human Resources Director/Ethics and Compliance Officer
